abstract: Major League Soccer Cup final matchup between Seattle Sounders and Toronto FC reflects new approach to investing in talent; teams' success is linked to abandoning strategy of signing aging international stars to massive contracts in favor of luring younger players willing to build their careers in MLS.

headline.print_headline: Major League Soccer Bypasses Big Names for Big (and Young) Talent
headline.main: M.L.S. Is Bypassing Big Names for Big (and Young) Talent

snippet: M.L.S. Cup on Saturday will feature highly paid designated players who represent a newer model for how teams are leaning toward players in their prime....
lead_paragraph: M.L.S. Cup on Saturday will feature highly paid designated players who represent a newer model for how teams are leaning toward players in their prime.
